title: Strengthening Systems Design Practical Competencies: Heritage Learner Service-Learning Design for Purpose-Specific Language Education

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate Korean language proficiency and understanding of basic mathematical terminology
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for IT/Software Development Professionals

learning_goals: Learners achieve over 80% accuracy in logical communication skills by explaining math problems in Korean during VR simulations

Learners plan one mathematics project themed on local community issues (e.g., optimizing waste sorting efficiency, improving public facility accessibility), generate at least three types of data visualizations (graphs/charts) using Python or Scratch, and deliver a 5-minute presentation appropriately using purpose-specific language (descriptive, explanatory, persuasive) for each stage: problem definition, solution proposal, and result analysis.

Learners document cases where they apply at least five mathematical terms (e.g., algorithm complexity, binary search, matrix operations) acquired through service-learning to real IT work scenarios (e.g., code optimization, data analysis, system design). They create a portfolio meeting three evaluation criteria: clarity, practicality, and creativity.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
